name: 陳斌豪
objective:
Heat and Mass Transfer is a vital subject for mechanical, chemical, production, aeronautical 
and metallurgical engineering disciplines. As a result of its multidisciplinary nature, it has 
many engineering applications. This course will introduce to students basic understanding of 
heat and mass transfer processes and their application to engineering problems. T
schedule:
Week 1.  INTRODUCTION – Typical heat transfer situations, Modes of heat transfer Introduction to laws, some heat transfer parameters 
Week 2.  CONDUCTION – Fourier’s law and thermal conductivity 1 hour 
Differential equation of heat conduction, boundary conditions and initial conditions 
Week 3.  Simple one dimensional steady state situations – plane wall, cylinder, sphere (simple and compex situations), concept of thermal resistance, concept of U, critical radius. variable thermal conductivity (exercise) 3 hours 
Week 4.  Special one dimensional steady state situations – heat generation, pin fins Other fin configurations (exercise) 
Week 5.  Two dimensional steady state situations 
Transient conduction Lumped capacitance model One dimensional transient problems – analytical solutions One dimensional Heisler charts Product solution 
Week 6.  Numerical methods in conduction Steady state one dimensional and two dimensional problems One dimensional transient problems – Explicit and implicit 
Week 7.  RADIATION Basic ideas, spectrum, basic definitions 1 hour 
Laws of radiation, black body radiation, Planck’s law, Stefan Boltzman law, Wien’s Displacement law, Lambert cosine law 
Week 8.  Convection heat transfer
FORCED CONVECTION Concepts of fluid mechanics  
Differential equation of heat convection  
Week 9. Mid term
Week 10.  Laminar flow heat transfer in circular pipe – constant heat flux and constant wall temperature, thermal entrance region, Turbulent flow heat transfer in circular pipe, pipes of other cross sections  
Week 11.  Heat transfer in laminar flow and turbulent flow over a flat plate, Reynolds analogy, Flow across a cylinder and sphere, flow across banks of tubes, impinging jets 
Week 12.  NATURAL CONVECTION Introduction, governing equations,Vertical plate – Pohlhausen solution, horizontal cylinder, horizontal plate, enclosed spaces  
Week 13.  HEAT EXCHANGERS Types of heat exchangers, LMTD approach – parallel, counter-flow, multi-pass and cross flow heat exchanger, NTU approach – parallel, counterflow, shell and tube, cross flow heat exchanger 
Week 14.  Condensation and Boiling Dimensionless parameters, boiling modes, correlations, 
Week 15.  Forced convection boiling, laminar film condensation on a vertical plate, turbulent film condensation  
Week 16.  Mass Transfer Analogy between heat and mass transfer, mass diffusion, Fick’s law of diffusion, boundary conditions, 
week 17.  steady mass diffusion through a wall, transient mass diffusion, mass convection, limitations of heat and mass transfer analogy. 
Week 18 final term
scorePolicy:
Attendance 10%
homework 20%
mid term 30%
final term 40%
materials: Fundamentals of Heat and Mass Transfer / Incropera, DeWitt
